pkgmetadata.longdescription: # airductSimple Pipeline Scheduler in Python![Airduct Screenshot](docs/screenshot.png)## Links- [Github](https://github.com/alairock/airduct)- [Documentation](https://airduct.readthedocs.io)## Installing $ pip install airductor $ poetry add airduct## QuickstartCreate a file and put into a folder/python-module.```pythonfrom airduct import schedule, taskschedule( name='ExampleFlow', run_at='* * * * *', flow=[ task('e1f1'), [task('e1f2'), task('e1f3', can_fail=True)], [task('e1f4')] ])async def e1f1(): print('e1f1 - An async function!')def e1f2(): print('e1f2 - Regular functions work too')async def e1f3(): print('e1f3')async def e1f4(): print('e1f4')```Run: `$ airduct schedule --path /path/to/folder`By default it uses a sqlite in-memory database. If using the in-memory database, it will also automatically run as a worker, in addition to a scheduler. If you wish to use a non in-memory sqlite database, you will need to also run a worker (could be on same box, or separate) See the documentation for more info.
